intro: Adiantum flexuosum, commonly known as the maidenhair fern, is a species of fern characterized by its delicate, finely divided fronds. It belongs to the family Adiantaceae and is native to the eastern United States and parts of Canada. The plant features a distinctive, arching growth habit with slender, wiry stems that often trail along the ground. Its leaves are typically bright green and have a leathery texture, with a unique, translucent appearance on the underside. Adiantum flexuosum thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodlands and along stream banks.
